text: Amélie Mauresmo was the defending champion, and successfully defended her title, defeating Kim Clijsters in the final 3–6, 6–3, 6–3. ==Seeds== The top four seeds receive a bye into the second round. ==Draw== ===Finals=== ===Top Half=== ===Bottom Half=== ==References== * Main and Qualifying Rounds 2006 Singles Proximus Diamond Games Proximus Diamond Games Diamond Games
title: 2006 Proximus Diamond Games – Singles
